answers.answer: 130 bpm is extremely high.  Has he contacted a doctor regarding this issue?  Normally this is condsidered Tachycardia, and yes, it is a condition that raises concern.  It can and does lead to some serious problems.  The fact that his cholesterol and blood pressure has been checked suggests he has seen a doctor.  Did the doctor suggest a beta-blocker drug to slow down the heart?  Also, diet is extremely important with a high heart rate, I'd throw away the salt shaker.  Has he been checked for diabetes?  Does he smoke?  Smoking raises the heart rate dramatically, it's one on the reasons smoking is such a huge heart risk.Good luck.  Keep us informed.

question: My husband is 5' 9" 250 lbs. His rest heart rate is 130. Should i be worried? His coloestrol is normal & blood pressure is okay.
title: My Husband
